title: Don't use Unicode when output locale doesn't support it
body_html:
On HEAD with Python 3, when I say print(x) in a terminal where LANG=en_US, I get:

  File "train_test.py", line 69, in Lop
    print(xs)
UnicodeEncodeError: 'latin-1' codec can't encode character '\u22ee' in position 5484: ordinal not in range(256)

The problem is our formatting generates a Unicode character and then we can't print it because the terminal isn't advertising support for it. Better to not generate Unicode in this case.

body:
On HEAD with Python 3, when I say `print(x)` in a terminal where `LANG=en_US`, I get:

```
  File "train_test.py", line 69, in Lop
    print(xs)
UnicodeEncodeError: 'latin-1' codec can't encode character '\u22ee' in position 5484: ordinal not in range(256)
```

The problem is our formatting generates a Unicode character and then we can't print it because the terminal isn't advertising support for it. Better to not generate Unicode in this case.
